intro: Psychotria aristata, commonly known as the sacred yew or the Amazonian psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It contains various alkaloids, including ibogaine, which have been studied for their psychoactive and medicinal properties. Psychotria aristata plays an important role in traditional medicine and spiritual practices among indigenous communities.
